introduction: Iâ€™m a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of British Columbia. Previously, I closely worked with Prof. Yu-Chiang Frank Wang at National Taiwan University and Prof. Ming-Hsuan Yang at UC Merced.
My Primary research interests lie in Computer Vision, with a particular focus on multi-modal models' adaptability, continual learning, and generation.
Prior to my role at VLLab, I was a Machine Learning Engineer at Dcard, where I designed a recommendation system using machine learning algorithms for over 15 million users.
I completed my bachelor's and master's degrees in Computer Science from National Taiwan University, where I conducted research in the Computational Learning Lab under Prof. Hsuan-Tien Lin.
